timeline.author: bstansberry
timeline.diffHunk:

 [[Undertow_using_as_a_Load_Balancer]]
 = Using WildFly as a Load Balancer
-:wildflyVersion: 10.1
+:wildflyVersion: 18.0

replies.bodyText: It's only used to generate a link at the bottom of the page at this page for wildscribe. Let me test if this can reference something else.
replies.author: rhusar

replies.bodyText: So this is actually an interesting one and I didn't think to look for other references to wildscribe, however I will. Since we're moving Wildscribe into the documentation we'll need to change the link. However it should be as simple as linking to wildscribe//subsystem/undertow/index.html so the version should not be required.
replies.author: jamezp

replies.bodyText: Doesn't look like too many other references, but I'll submit a PR to update the others.
replies.author: jamezp

replies.bodyText:
FWIW, if I build the docs in master,  for that link I get https://wildscribe.github.io/WildFly/20/subsystem/undertow/index.html and the published page at https://docs.wildfly.org/18/Admin_Guide.html has https://wildscribe.github.io/WildFly/18/subsystem/undertow/index.html. So whatever is in this line of the adoc seems to not take effect, and the camel case vs lower case thing I noted also doesn't matter.
Unfortunately though the https://wildscribe.github.io/WildFly/18/subsystem/undertow/index.html link is wrong as it would need to be 18.0 not 18. Hopefully James' wildscribe//subsystem/undertow/index.html suggestion fixes that.
replies.author: bstansberry

replies.bodyText:
@bstansberry The difference is that if you view the file on github - it will resolve to whatever version I am changing here as opposed to when you build, you get the link with the version you are building.
Lets try the James' way.
replies.author: rhusar

replies.bodyText: Thanks Rado; I keep forgetting about the view-it-on-github use case.
